examples: I expect the house to be spotless upon my return .
Do you want a one-way or a return ?

definitions.definition: An item that is returned , e.g. due to a defect , or the act of returning it.
examples: Last year there were 250 returns of this product, an improvement on the 500 returns the year before.

definitions.definition: An account, or formal report, of an action performed, of a duty discharged, of facts or statistics, etc.; especially, in the plural, a set of tabulated statistics prepared for general information.
examples: election returns ; a return of the amount of goods produced or sold

definitions.definition: Gain or loss from an investment.
A report of income submitted to a government for purposes of specifying exact tax payment amounts; a tax return .
examples: Hand in your return within 90 days of the end of the tax year.

definitions.definition: The act of relinquishing control to the calling procedure.
A return value : the data passed back from a called procedure.
A return pipe , returning fluid to a boiler or other central plant (compare with flow pipe, which carries liquid away from a central plant).
examples: The boiler technician had to cut out the heating return to access the safety valve.

definitions.definition: A roadway along which foul air travels from the face on its way out of the mine .
A short perpendicular extension of a desk , usually slightly lower.
The act of catching a ball after a punt and running it back towards the opposing team.
A throw from a fielder to the wicket-keeper or to another fielder at the wicket .

The continuation in a different direction, most often at a right angle, of a building, face of a building, or any member, such as a moulding; applied to the shorter in contradistinction to the longer.
examples: A facade of sixty feet east and west has a return of twenty feet north and south.
